title: Agent Graph Utilization Guidance
body:
Purpose: Provide agents a compact operating pattern for using the instruction relationship graph.

Core Principles:
1. Always query JSON graph/export (never reason from Mermaid).
2. Start sparse: enrich=true, includeCategoryNodes=true, includeEdgeTypes=[primary].
3. Expand only if needed with belongs edges; avoid category edges unless small subset.
4. Cache graph by governance hash; refetch only on change.
5. Rank related instructions by category overlap + usageCount + recency + degree centrality.
6. Prefer local Jaccard(categorySets) for similarity over dense pairwise edges.
7. Report anomalies (orphans, stale hubs, duplicates) via feedback tools.
8. Summaries to user must justify each instruction (overlap & recency).

Scoring (adaptable): score = 0.5*overlap + 0.25*log(1+usage) + 0.15*recency + 0.10*centrality.

Failure Fallback: If graph/export fails, retry with primary-only; if still failing, fall back to instruction search + category heuristics and disclose limitation.

Do Nots: Do not fetch category edges first; do not surface entire raw graph; do not rely on stale hash; do not parse Mermaid for logic.

Extended detail: see docs/AGENT-GRAPH-INSTRUCTIONS.md.

semanticSummary: Compact agent operating directive for efficient graph usage and ranking heuristics.
